abstract: Bank of America  didn’t pay its chief executive, Kenneth Lewis, or any of its other top executives a bonus last year, like most major U.S. banks, saying its 2008 financial results didn’t meet its expectations.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America  didn’t pay its chief executive, Kenneth Lewis, or any of its other top executives a bonus last year, like most major U.S. banks, saying its 2008 financial results didn’t meet its expectations.

headline.main: BofA’s Lewis and Others Took No Bonus in ’08

abstract: Standard & Poor’s cut its credit rating on Bank of America to A from A+ on Tuesday afternoon, citing the weak economy and warning that its Merrill Lynch and Countrywide Financial units were likely to continue to weigh on the bank’s earnings.
lead_paragraph: Standard & Poor’s cut its credit rating on Bank of America to A from A+ on Tuesday afternoon, citing the weak economy and warning that its Merrill Lynch and Countrywide Financial units were likely to continue to weigh on the bank’s earnings.

headline.main: S.&P. Cuts Bank of America’s Rating Again
